sections.title: Protect the Plan Before You Grow It
sections.subtitle: Identify coverage gaps that could derail long-term financial goals

sections.title: What You'll Learn
items: How to size emergency and insurance buffers
Coverage checklists for life, health, disability, and property
Decision framework for self-insuring vs. transferring risk
Annual review cadence to keep policies aligned with life changes

sections.title: Layer Your Defenses
sections.content: Start with emergency savings, then add insurance tailored to income, dependents, and asset protection needs. The right mix prevents a single event from wiping out years of progress.

points.title: Income Protection
points.description: Disability and life insurance replace earnings so goals remain funded if you can't work.

points.title: Health Costs
points.description: High-deductible plans pair well with HSAs; evaluate out-of-pocket maximums carefully.

points.title: Asset Safeguards
points.description: Home, auto, and umbrella policies shield net worth from lawsuits or catastrophic losses.

sections.title: Review Beneficiaries
sections.content: Ensure policy beneficiaries match your estate documents. Misalignment delays payouts and complicates tax planning.

sections.title: Risk Audit Checklist
steps: List all existing policies with coverage amounts, premiums, and renewal dates.
Calculate income replacement needs for both short-term disability and long-term support.
Assess health plan options during open enrollment and model worst-case expenses.
Request quotes for umbrella coverage if net worth exceeds liability limits.
Schedule annual insurance review aligned with financial plan check-ins.

sections.title: Bundle Strategically
sections.content: Combining policies (home, auto, umbrella) often yields discounts, but verify coverage quality before consolidating.
